name: daube
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a dish, originally from the south of France, of meat, vegetables, and herbs cooked slowly in a small amount of liquid in a pot with a lid: daube of My main course was a braised daube of beef. The daube is not just a dish, it is a method of cooking in particular kind of casserole. Compare
stew
More examplesFewer examplesThe daube of pork with turnips had a rich dark gravy.Each region of France has its own variation of the daube.Among the excellent stews on offer at the restaurant is daube Provençale.This dish was like a daube, with chunks of beef in a rich garlicky gravy.Boeuf en daube is a tender beef stew, sometimes served in a special dish.
